sentence.text: This leads to highly agitated motions and correspondingly high temperatures .
His two thumbs rotated about one another as they always did when he was agitated and looking for a way to strike .
She was agitated ; there were a few tears .
Little Maureen was agitated , but she made a nice speech .
` When we came to tell you that the service was postponed you were in a very agitated state -- but then it was difficult to persuade you to leave off playing . "
` When a police sergeant revisited Mr Thompson he was still clearly the worse for drink and was in an agitated state . "
He was becoming agitated .
It could well become agitated at the dispersal of the pigeons , turn its head towards the lights , and bark heatedly at the roadworkers .
The priest became agitated .
The Spaniard was becoming agitated again , wondering whether he had already gone too far .
She was getting agitated .
Do n't get agitated .
He paced about for some time , looking agitated .
Rachel and her mother looked agitated .
Country and Western is suitable for calming an agitated animal
It emerged that , in conscious and especially in excited or agitated patients , the drug produced a remarkable state of inactivity or indifference .
Annabel said in an agitated voice , ` I feel as if my mind is whirling madly , like a hurricane .
Just before we were to go upstairs to be photographed , an agitated Nigel Lawson came up to me saying that he wanted a word .

The boss sounded agitated when I spoke to him over the phone . "
At Portsmouth , Lily Lee creatively amplifies a passage from Machiavelli 's The Prince , inscribing a chilling statement in a bold agitated hand .
An agitated old lady addressed Ramsey severely and asked why he did not go back to his own country and do good there instead of stirring up trouble in the United States .
More usually it left him ashamed and angry , despite his wife 's kind words of consolation , and Ashi herself in an agitated state of dissatisfaction and unhappiness .
He seemed agitated , restlessly pacing about , looking out into the crowds , then drawing back into the shelter of the arcade .
Nevertheless , Maeve 's sharp eyes had missed nothing ; her husband looked exhausted , troubled , and now she felt agitated .
Suddenly , a wave of tiredness swept through her and she closed her eyes for a moment , during which the girl remained quiet , but visibly agitated and eager to be getting on with her work .
Behind the front door hovered a small and wiry man who appeared greatly agitated and whose polished bald head was flushed and sweating profusely in spite of the cold .
Perhaps the mural makes it new , so shamelessly bright upon the wall like something spilt , and the restless assortment of weekend patrons who watch the stage with agitated and expectant eyes .
